info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:34PM CDT until June 24 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN FOARD AND KNOX COUNTIES... At 1034 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Chalk to 4 miles northwest of Benjamin to 4 miles southeast of O`Brien, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. The greatest hail threat exists between Knox City and Benjamin. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Munday, Knox City, Benjamin, Goree, Vera, Truscott, Gilliland, and Rhineland. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
